column4: anyone know how to change the default load location of an app?
(position and size)
firefox always loads all the way to the left ( which I don't like ) I want it to be centered
compiz can specify workspaces where an app starts, you can also use devilspie (use gdevilspie to configure (available from google-code0)
ps -ef | grep -i compiz     will show if you are ;)
it will output a compiz process (you will always get a grep process)
only one desktop is loaded at a time, all it uses is drive space
here's mine http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8850924/Blue%20Abstract.jpg
sudo apt-get install samba
you can then use nautilus to share folders
its already installed i think
the OS will tell you if it is:)
no, justsamba, not samba4
so its normal for it to say that when I type in 'samba' in terminal
samba   itself isn't a program to run
it installs a service which you then configure
sweet :)
it's /etc/samba/smb.conf
I can give my config file if you want. Shows how shares are defined
http://paste.ubuntu.com/849270/
last few lines are what you need
sudo updatedb; locate filename
samba uses the one in /etc/samba
run:  sudo smbpasswd -a $USER     then set a password for your username and you can authorise with that.
